tips.text: Use a silk pillowcase to prevent friction and reduce tangling.
Brush your extensions gently starting from the bottom upward.
Use sulfate-free shampoo to extend the life of your extensions.
Avoid sleeping with wet hair to prevent matting.
Use a heat protectant before styling to avoid dryness.
Tie your hair in a loose braid before bed.
Deep condition your hair weekly to maintain hydration.
Avoid heavy oils at the roots to prevent slipping.
Detangle your hair with a wide-tooth comb.
Keep hot tools under 170°C to avoid damaging your extensions.
Wash your hair every 7–10 days to keep extensions fresh.
Use leave-in conditioner to reduce frizz.
Trim the ends every 6–8 weeks for a polished finish.
Do not use products containing alcohol—they dry out extensions.
Brush your hair 2–3 times daily to avoid tangling.
Rinse hair with cool water after conditioning to lock in shine.
Avoid tight ponytails that pull on extension bonds.
Use dry shampoo sparingly to prevent buildup.
Visit your stylist every 4–6 weeks for maintenance.
Always support your roots when brushing to prevent tension.
